quest_title: The power of lens made by glass of \(\mu\) = 1.5 is 5D what is the R.I. of liquid when this lens is immersed then power become -1D?
explanation_txt:
\(\quad\)p = (\(\mu-\) 1) \( \left(\cfrac{1}{R_{1}} + \cfrac{1}{R_{2}}\right) \)

\(\quad\)or, \( \cfrac{1}{R_{1}} + \cfrac{1}{R_{2}} = \cfrac{5}{1.5 - 1} \) = 10

\(\operatorname{Again}, \mathrm{p}^{\prime}=\left(_{1} \mu_{\mathrm{g}}-1\right)\left(\cfrac{1}{\mathrm{R}_{1}}+\cfrac{1}{\mathrm{R}_{2}}\right)\)

\(-1=\left(\cfrac{\mathrm{_a} \mu_{\mathrm{g}}}{_{\mathrm{a} \mu}}-1\right) 10\)

\(\cfrac{\mathrm{a} \mu_{\mathrm{g}}}{\mathrm{a} \mu_{l}}=1-\cfrac{1}{10}=\cfrac{9}{10}\)
\(\therefore \mathrm{_a} \mu_{l}=\cfrac{10 \times 1.5}{9}=1.66\)

quest_title:
The force of surface tension on a ring situated on the surface of water is 14\(\pi \times \)10\({}^{-4}\)N. The diameter of ring is

(Surface tension of water = 70\(\times\)10\({}^{-3}\)N/m)
explanation_txt:
\(\mathrm{F}=2(2 \pi \mathrm{r}) \mathrm{T}\)
\(\mathrm{r}=\cfrac{\mathrm{F}}{4 \pi \mathrm{T}}=\cfrac{14 \pi \times 10^{-4}}{2 \pi \times 70 \times 10^{-3}}=5 \times 10^{-3} \mathrm{m}\)
\(\therefore \mathrm{d}=2 \mathrm{r}=2 \times 5 \times 10^{-3} \mathrm{m}=0.01 \mathrm{m}\)

quest_title: Telescope consists of two thin lenses of focal length 0.3m and 0.03m separated by 0.33m is focused on moon subtend an angle of 0.5\({}^{o}\) at objective. The angle made by final image at eye lens will be
explanation_txt:
\(\mathrm{m}=\cfrac{\mathrm{f}_{\mathrm{o}}}{\mathrm{f}_{\mathrm{e}}}=\cfrac{\beta}{\alpha}\)

\(\therefore \beta=\cfrac{0.3}{0.03} \times 0.5=5^{\circ}\)

quest_title: A beam of light AO is incident on a glass slab \((\mu=1.54\) in a direction as shown in figure. The reflected ray OB is passed through a Nicol prism on viewing through a Nicole prism, we find on rotating the prism that
ans1_txt: The intensity is reduced down to zero and remains zero
ans2_txt: The intensity reduces down some what and rises again
ans4_txt: The intensity gradually reduces to zero and then again increases
explanation_txt:
In the arrangement shown, the unpolarized light is incident at polarizing angle of 90° – 33° = 57°. The reflected light is thus plane polarized light. When plane polarized light is passed through Nicol prism which acts as analyzer, intensity of light is given by Malus's law.

\(I = I _ { 0 } \cos ^ { 2 } \theta\)

\(\therefore\) The intensity gradually reduces to zero and finally increases.
question_plain_title: A beam of light AO is incident on a glass slab in a direction as shown in figure. The reflected ray OB is passed through a Nicol prism on viewing through a Nicole prism, we find on rotating the prism that
explanation_plain_text:
In the arrangement shown, the unpolarized light is incident at polarizing angle of 90° – 33° = 57°. The reflected light is thus plane polarized light. When plane polarized light is passed through Nicol prism which acts as analyzer, intensity of light is given by Malus's law.

The intensity gradually reduces to zero and finally increases.
ans1_plain_text: The intensity is reduced down to zero and remains zero
ans2_plain_text: The intensity reduces down some what and rises again
ans4_plain_text: The intensity gradually reduces to zero and then again increases

quest_title: A ball is thrown from the ground with a velocity of \(20\sqrt{3}\) m/s making an angle of 60\(^{\circ}\) with horizontal. The ball will be at a height of 40 m from ground after time
explanation_txt:
\(h=u \sin \theta t-\cfrac{1}{2} g t^{2} \)
\(\text { or, } 40=20 \sqrt{3} \times \sin 60 t-\cfrac{1}{2} \times 10 t^{2} \)
\(\text { or, } 5 t^{2}-30 t+40=0 \)
\(\text { or, } t^{2}-6 t+8=0 \)

\(\text { or, } t=2 \text { or } 4\)

\(\therefore t=2 \, sec\)

quest_title: A convex lens of focal length 12cm is made of glass of \(\mu\)\({}_{g}\) = 3/2. The focal length in liquid of refractive index \(\mu\)\({}_{1}\) = 5/4 is
explanation_txt:
In air
\(\cfrac{1}{\mathrm{f}_{\mathrm{a}}}=\left(\mu_{\mathrm{g}}-1\right)\left(\cfrac{1}{\mathrm{R}_{1}}+\cfrac{1}{\mathrm{R}_{1}}\right)\)
\(\cfrac{1}{\mathrm{R}_{1}}+\cfrac{1}{\mathrm{R}_{1}}=\cfrac{1}{12(1.5-1)}=\cfrac{1}{6}\)

For liquid

\(\cfrac{1}{\mathrm{f}_{1}}=\left(\cfrac{\mu_{\mathrm{g}}}{\mu_{l}}-1\right)\left(\cfrac{1}{\mathrm{R}_{1}}+\cfrac{1}{\mathrm{R}_{l}}\right)=\left(\cfrac{1.5}{5} \times 4-1\right) \cfrac{1}{6}\)
\(\therefore \mathrm{f}_{l}=30 \mathrm{cm}\)

explanation_plain_text:
In air

For liquid

quest_title: The frequency of a tunning far is marked as 510Hz. It is found to produce 2 beats/sec when sounded with another fork of frequcny 512Hz, the fork produce 4beats/sec when sounded with a fork of frequency 510Hz. The correct frequency of the fork is
explanation_txt:
Since marked fork gives two beats with 512Hz, hence frequency of the fork will be either 510Hz or 54Hz.

Again, The marked fork gives four beats with 510Hz, hence frequency of fork will be either 506Hz or 514Hz. common frequency in These two cases = 514Hz. Hence the correct frequency of the fork = 514Hz.
question_plain_title: The frequency of a tunning far is marked as 510Hz. It is found to produce 2 beats/sec when sounded with another fork of frequcny 512Hz, the fork produce 4beats/sec when sounded with a fork of frequency 510Hz. The correct frequency of the fork is
explanation_plain_text:
Since marked fork gives two beats with 512Hz, hence frequency of the fork will be either 510Hz or 54Hz.

Again, The marked fork gives four beats with 510Hz, hence frequency of fork will be either 506Hz or 514Hz. common frequency in These two cases = 514Hz. Hence the correct frequency of the fork = 514Hz.

quest_title: The locus of the centre of the circle which cuts a chord of length 2a from the positive x-axis and passes through a point on positive y-axis distant b from the origin is:
explanation_txt:
Here, \(2 \sqrt { g ^ { 2 } - c } = 2 a \Rightarrow g ^ { 2 } - a ^ { 2 } - c = 0 \dots (i) \)

and it passes through \( (0,b) \) therefore,

\(b ^ { 2 } + 2 f b + c = 0 \dots (ii) \)

Adding (i) and (ii), \(g ^ { 2 } + 2 f b = a ^ { 2 } - b ^ { 2 }\)

Hence the locus is \(x ^ { 2 } + 2 b y = a ^ { 2 } - b ^ { 2 }\)

quest_title: Nitrous acid is a/an
explanation_txt:
The oxidation state of nitrogen in \(HNO_2\) is +3 which lies in between the possible oxidation states of nitrogen i.e. (+5) and (-3). So, it acts as both reductant and oxidant.

\(HNO_2\) as an oxidant:

\(\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{S}+2 \mathrm{HNO}_{2} \longrightarrow 2 \mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{O}+2 \mathrm{NO}+\mathrm{S}\)

\(HNO_2\) as an reductant:

\(\mathrm{HNO}_{2}+\mathrm{I}_{2}+\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{O} \longrightarrow 2 \mathrm{HI}+\mathrm{HNO}_{3}\)

quest_title: A body is projected at 45\({}^{o}\) with horizontal has range 16m. If it explodes into two equal parts at highest point out of which one fall downward from point of explosion then other part will fall at a distance from starting point
explanation_txt:
\(\mathrm{R}=16=\cfrac{\mathrm{u}^{2}}{\mathrm{g}} \)
\(\therefore \mathrm{u}=\sqrt{160} \)

At highest point,

\(\mathrm{u}_{\mathrm{x}}=\mathrm{u} \cos 45^{\circ}=\sqrt{160} \times \cfrac{1}{\sqrt{2}}=\sqrt{80} \mathrm{m} / \mathrm{s}\)

Again,

\(2 \mathrm{mu}_{\mathrm{x}}=\mathrm{mu}_{\mathrm{x}}^{\prime} \)
\(\mathrm{u}_{\mathrm{x}}^{\prime}=2 \sqrt{80} \mathrm{m} / \mathrm{s} \)
\(\mathrm{R}=4 \mathrm{H} \cot \theta \)
or, \(\mathrm{H}=\cfrac{16}{4}=4 \mathrm{m} \)

\(\mathrm{t}=\sqrt{\cfrac{2 \mathrm{H}}{\mathrm{g}}}=\sqrt{\cfrac{2 \times 4}{10}}=0.9 \mathrm{sec}\)

Distance from top,

\(\mathrm{R}^{\prime}=\mathrm{u}_{\mathrm{x}}^{\prime} \times \mathrm{t}=2 \sqrt{80} \times 0.9=16 \mathrm{m}\)

\(\text { Total distance }\left(\mathrm{R}_{\mathrm{T}}\right)=8+16=24 \mathrm{m}\)

\(=e+(e-1)+\cfrac{1}{2} (e-1)=\cfrac{5e}{2} -\cfrac{3}{2} .\)

OR

quest_title: The intensity of a sound increases to 1000 times then the increase in intensity level is
explanation_txt:
\(\mathrm{I}_{2}=1000 \mathrm{I}_{1} \quad \Rightarrow \mathrm{I}_{2} / \mathrm{I}_{1}=10^{3}\)
\(\mathrm{n}_{2}-\mathrm{n}_{1}=10 \log \left(\cfrac{I_{2}}{I_{1}}\right)\)
\(\Delta \mathrm{n}=10 \log _{10} 10^{3}=10 \times 3 \log _{10} 10=30 \mathrm{db}\)

quest_title: Verdigiris is:
explanation_txt:
Basic copper acetate i.e, \( Cu(CH_3COO)_2 \cdot Cu(OH)_2 \) is called verdigiris and is used as pigment in paints.

explanation_txt:

\[M_{2} V_{2} =5.\]

which is satisfied by option (d)

quest_title: The number of unpaired electrons in \(\text{N\({i}\)\(^{2+}\)}\) (z = 28) is
explanation_txt:
Electronic configuration of \(Ni^{++}\) is

\(1s^22s^23s^23p^63d^64s^2\)

d subshell has 5 orbitals and \(Ni^{++}\) has 6 d electrons

This means only 1 orbital has paired electorns and rest 4 has unpaired electrons.
